data.name: s0
data.value: How to Perform Fard Salaah

data.name: s1
data.value: Step 1: Begin with your niyyah (intention)

data.name: s10
data.value: Subhana Rabbiyal Adhim {Glory be to my Lord Almighty} x3

data.name: s11
data.value: Step 6: Next stand up from the bowing position. While coming up from ruku your hands should be at your side and not crossed at the chest. Then recite the following:

data.name: s12
data.value: Sami’Allahu liman hamidah {Allah hears those who praise Him}

data.name: s13
data.value: Rabbana lakal hamd {Our lord, to you be the praise}

data.name: s14
data.value: Step 7: Say Allahu Akbar and go down for sajdah (prostration). There should 5 points of contact with the ground, your forehead, nose, palms of hand, knees, and toes of the feet. Put your head between your palms such that your thumbs are aligned with earlobes. The elbows should be raised away from the ground. Then recite the following 3 times:

data.name: s15
data.value: Subhana Rabbiyal A’la {How Perfect is my Lord, the Highest}

data.name: s16
data.value: Step 8: Say Allahu Akbar, sit upright. It is sunnah to keep your right foot up and lay the left foot on the ground. This position is called Jalsah Al-istiraha or the sitting position of the prayer. Rest your hands on the thighs with fingers reaching the knees. Recite the following:

data.name: s17
data.value: Rabbighfir li {O my Lord! Forgive me}

data.name: s18
data.value: Say Allahu Akbar and go down for your second sujud, repeat Step 7. After completing Step 7, say Allahu Akbar and stand back up and cross your arms just as before. This represents one complete rakat of salah.

data.name: s19
data.value: Now repeat Steps 4 to 8.

data.name: s2
data.value: "I intend to perform the (number of rakats) of the (name of prayer)." An example would be; "I intend to perform 4 rakats of the sunnah salaah for the Asr prayer".

data.name: s20
data.value: Step 9: When you complete the second sujood of the second rakat stay seated in position of Jalsah (the seating position explained in Step 8). Then recite the following (The Tashahhud}:

data.name: s21
data.value: Attahiyat lillahi wa salawatu wa’t-tayyibat, as-salamu ‘alayka ayyuha’n-Nabiyyu wa rahmat-Allahi wa barakatuhu. As-salamu ‘alayna wa ‘alaa ‘ibad-Illah is-saliheen {All the best compliments and the prayers and the good things are for Allah. Peace and Allah’s Mercy and Blessings be on you, O Prophet! Peace be on us and on the pious slaves of Allah}

data.name: s22
data.value: Then recite the Shahadah as shown below. While doing this ball up your right hand into a fist and raise your index finger. This symbolizes the tawhid or oneness of Allah.

data.name: s23
data.value: Ashhadu alla ilaha illallah wa ashhadu anna muhammadan ‘abduhu wa rasuluhu {I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and I also testify that Muhammad is Allah’s slave and His Messenger.}

data.name: s24
data.value: At this point, you would say Allahu Akbar and begin your third rakat and fourth rakat. Follow the steps listed above, but only recite Surah Fatiha without reciting an additional Surah. When you reach the second Jalsah of your fourth rakat, move on to Step 10.

data.name: s25
data.value: Step 10: After you have completed Step 9, begin reciting the following whilst in the Jalsah position:

data.name: s26
data.value: Allahumma salli ‘ala Muhammadin Wa ‘ala ali Muhammadin Kama sallaita ‘ala Ibrahima wa ‘ala ali Ibrahima wa barik ‘ala Muhammadin wa ‘ala ali Muhammadin Kama barakta ‘ ala Ibrahima Wa ‘ ala ali Ibrahima Fil a’lamina Innaka hamidun Majid {O Allah, let Your mercy come upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You let it come upon Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim. Truly You are Praiseworthy and Glorious}

data.name: s27
data.value: Step 11: Turn your face towards looking over your right shoulder, reciting the line below. Then turn your face towards looking over your left shoulder and repeat it,

data.name: s28
data.value: Assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullah {Peace and the mercy of Allah be on you}

data.name: s29
data.value: After reciting Surah Al-Fatiha, recite one other Surah from the Quran. The easiest Surahs to recite for beginners are linked below.

data.name: s3
data.value: Step 2: Setup your Salaah Area

data.name: s4
data.value: Lay down your prayer mat in a clean area, in the direction of the Qiblah (the direction of the Kabaa in Mecca). Direct your gaze towards the place of your sajdah (prostration). Now, with palms open, raise your hands to your ears and say the Takbir (Allahu Akbar) which means Allah is the greatest. Your prayer has now commenced. Women praying should raise their hands to their shoulders.

data.name: s5
data.value: Step 3: After Takbir, place cross your hands at chest level grabbing your left wrist with your right hand. Then recite the following:

data.name: s6
data.value: Subhaanaka Allaahumma wa bihamdika, wa tabaarakasmuka, wa ta’aalaa jadduka, wa laa ‘ilaaha ghayruka {Glory and praise be to You, O Allah. Blessed be Your name and exalted be Your majesty, there is none worthy of worship except You}

data.name: s7
data.value: Bismillah hir rahman nir raheem {In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful}

data.name: s8
data.value: Step 4: After this, recite Surah Al-Fatiha.

data.name: s9
data.value: Step 5: Say Allahu Akbar, bend down for ruku. Ruku is the position where you keep your head and back aligned and put your hands on your knees. Then recite the following 3 times:

data.name: surahdaybreak
data.value: Surah of the Daybreak

data.name: surahfatiha
data.value: Surah Fatiha

data.name: surahmen
data.value: Surah of Men

data.name: surahsincerity
data.value: Surah of Sincerity
